text: (born April 2, 1990) is an American professional basketball player who last played for Union Neuchâtel in Switzerland. ==College career== He played four seasons with the Wisconsin Badgers, in which he averaged 7.2 points, 3.8 rebounds and 1.2 blocks per game.sports-reference.com Jared Berggren Stats, accessed 20 April 2018 In his senior season he was named to the Second Team All Big Ten Conference by both by the media the coaches, as well as being the best defensive team of the conference. ==Professional career== After not being selected in the 2013 NBA Draft, he signed with B.C. Oostende of the Belgian league.sportando.com Telenet Oostende, firmato il rookie Jared Berggren, accessed 20 April 2018 In his first season on the team he averaged 7.0 points and 5.0 rebounds per game.Jared Berggren at Realgm, accessed 20 April 2018 After losing much of the following season, in July 2015 he signed for a season with the Pallacanestro Cantù of the Italian league.sportando.com Pallacanestro Cantù announces Jared Berggren, accessed 20 April 2018 He played 14 games, averaging at 6.8 points and 5.2 rebounds before being fired in February 2016.sportando.com Pallacanestro Cantù and Jared Berggren part ways, accessed 20 April 2018 The following day he signed a contract with Aquila Basket Trento for the rest of the season,sportando.com Aquila Basket Trento announces Jared Berggren, accessed 20 April 2018 playing eleven games in which he averaged 4.0 points and 3.2 rebounds. In August 2016 he signed for a season with the Basket Brescia Leonessa.sportando.com Jared Berggren signs with Germani Basket Brescia, accessed 20 April 2018 He spent the 2017-18 season with Shinshu Brave Warriors in Japan. On July 9, 2018, Berggren signs a one-year contract with Union Neuchâtel. ==References== ==External links== *Wisconsin Badgers bio Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:American expatriate basketball people in Belgium Category:American expatriate basketball people in Italy Category:American expatriate basketball people in Japan Category:American expatriate basketball people in Switzerland Category:American men's basketball players Category:Aquila Basket Trento players Category:Basketball players from Minnesota Category:Basket Brescia Leonessa players Category:BC Oostende players Category:Centers (basketball) Category:Niigata Albirex BB players Category:Pallacanestro Cantù players Category:People from Princeton, Minnesota Category:Shinshu Brave Warriors players Category:Sportspeople from the Minneapolis–Saint Paul metropolitan area Category:Union Neuchâtel Basket players Category:Wisconsin Badgers men's basketball players
title: Jared Berggren
